detaileddescription.para: From RGB to YIQ: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YIQ
From YIQ to RGB: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YIQ

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Mat > &vid, vector< Mat > &GDownStack, int startIndex, int endIndex, int level)
memberdef.name: build_Gdown_Stack

detaileddescription.para:
Apply Gaussian pyramid decomposition on vid from startIndex to endIndex, and select a specific band indicated by level.
GDownStack is stack of one band of Gaussian pyramid of each frame
vid GDownStack
the first dimension is the time axis
the second dimension is the y axis of the video's frames
the third dimension is the x axis of the video's frames
the forth dimension is the color channel Data type: CV_64FC3 or CV_64F

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Mat > &vid, vector< Mat > &ans, String outDir, double alpha, int level, double freqBandLowEnd, double freqBandHighEnd, double samplingRate, double chromAttenuation)
memberdef.name: eulerianGaussianPyramidMagnification

detaileddescription.para:
Use Eulerian magnification technique on input frames. Spatial Filtering: Gaussian blur and down sample Temporal Filtering: Ideal bandpass http://graphics.cs.cmu.edu/courses/15-463/2012_fall/hw/proj2g-eulerian/
outDir
output folder for debug files
alpha
magnification rate
level
see blurDnClr()
freqBandLowEnd
see wl argument in ideal_bandpassing()
freqBandHighEnd
see wh argument in ideal_bandpassing()
samplingRate
the video's frame rate
chromAttenuation
the magnification rate of chromA channel in YIQ coulourspace

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Mat > &src, vector< Mat > &dst, double wl, double wh, double samplingRate)
memberdef.name: ideal_bandpassing

detaileddescription.para:
Apply ideal band pass filter on src. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Band-pass_filter
src dst
the first dimension is the time axis
the second dimension is the y axis of the video's frames
the third dimension is the x axis of the video's frames
the forth dimension is the color channel
wl
lower cutoff frequency of ideal band pass filter
wh
higher cutoff frequency of ideal band pass filter
samplingRate
sampling rate of src Data type: CV_64FC3 or CV_64F
read frames from a file to a a Mat vector
read a 2D Mat (rows * cols) from an opened file
read a vector<double> with n elements from an opened file
read an integer from an opened file
read a double number from an opened file

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< double > &src, const String &outFile, bool append)
memberdef.name: writeVector

detaileddescription.para:
write a vector<double> to a file.
append
if == true, then the function will append the vector at the end of the file, otherwise, it will overwrite the old file or create a new file
write a 2D Mat to an image file
write a 2D Mat to a file as text for the specified channel

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Mat > &monoframes, const String &conversion_method, double fr, double cutoff_freq, double &lower_range, double &upper_range, bool isCalcMode)
memberdef.name: frames2signal

detaileddescription.para:
The function will convert the array of frames into an array of signal value (type double) note that the frame is mono channel.
fr
video's frame rate
conversion_method
we have 3 method for converting a frame into a double value:
simple-mean
trimmed-mean
mode-balance

inbodydescription.para: mode : 'simple-mean' get the mean of all pixel's value in the picture frame
mode : 'trimmed-mean' get the mean of all pixel's value in a smaller rectangle inside the picture frame

this method will calculate the histogram of pixel's value from the first_tranning_frames_start to first_tranning_frames_end. Then get the bin that has the most number of value, get the centre of that bin as a centre value, then use the prctile function to get the percentile of that centre value. Finally we calculate the mean of values that have the inverted percentile in the range from (centre value's percentile - lower_pct_range) to (centre value's percentile + upper_pct_range).

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< double > &temporal_mean, double fr, int firstSample, int window_size, double overlap_ratio, double minPeakDistance, hrDebug &debug)
memberdef.name: hb_counter_autocorr

detaileddescription.para:
This function will convert the signal array (after using the frame2signal function) to an autocorelation array and then convert to an array of heart beats' position. The function will shift a window with size window_size from firstSample position to calculate the heart beats in that window. This function is different from the hb_counter_pda function, instead of calculating the heart beats directly from the signal array, we will first convert the signal array to an autocorrelation array ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autocorrelation) then use this array to calculate the heart beats.
fr
the frame rate.
overlap_ratio
the ratio of the next window will be identical with the current window, at default this ratio value is 0
minPeakDistance threshold
these arguments are for the findPeaks function.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< double > temporal_mean, double fr, int firstSample, int window_size, double overlap_ratio, double minPeakDistance, double threshold, hrDebug &debug)
memberdef.name: hb_counter_pda

detaileddescription.para:
This function will convert the signal array (after using the frame2signal() function) to an array of heart beats' position The function will shift a window with size window_size from firstSample position to calculate the heart beats in that window.
fr
the frame rate.
overlap_ratio
the ratio of the next window will be identical with the current window, at default this ratio value is 0
minPeakDistance threshold
these arguments are for the findPeaks function.

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< int > &heartBeatPositions, double frameRate, vector< double > &ans)
memberdef.name: hr_calculator

detaileddescription.para:
Calculate the heart-rate from a list of heart-beat positions.
ans
the first number is average heart-rate
the second number is mode of the instantaneous heart-rates multiply with frameRate*60

see hb_counter_pda() or hb_counter_autocorr().

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Mat > &vid, double overlap_ratio, double max_bpm, double cutoff_freq, int colour_channel, String colourspace, double &lower_range, double &upper_range, bool isCalcMode)
memberdef.name: temporal_mean_calc

detaileddescription.para:
Convert frames of <vid> to signals.
vid
data type is CV_64FC3 or CV_64F
overlap_ratio
overlap ratio between 2 consecutive segments
max_bpm
maximum heart rate detectable (use in determining minPeaksDistance in findpeaks())
colour_channel
if in _THREE_CHAN_MODE, then convert all frames of vid to monoframes by select only one channel of each frame.
colourspace
if in _THREE_CHAN_MODE, then convert colourspace of all frames of vid to "hsv", "ycbcr" or "tsl" before converting them to monoframes
cutoff_freq lower_range upper_range> isCalcMode
see frames2signal()
convert a RGB frame to a TSL frame Data type: CV_64FC3 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TSL_color_space

Blur and downsample an image. The blurring is done with filter kernel specified by FILT (default = 'binom5') https://github.com/diego898/matlab-utils/blob/master/toolbox/EVM_Matlab/blurDnClr.m http://docs.opencv.org/doc/tutorials/imgproc/pyramids/pyramids.html

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mat &src, Mat &dst, const Mat &filter, int rectRow, int rectCol)
memberdef.name: corrDn

detaileddescription.para:
Compute correlation of 2D matrices src with filter, followed by downsampling. http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/43909-separable-steerable-pyramid-toolbox/content/sepspyr/deps/matlabPyrTools-1.3/mpt_corrDn.m http://docs.opencv.org/modules/imgproc/doc/filtering.html#void%20filter2D%28InputArray%20src,%20OutputArray%20dst,%20int%20ddepth,%20InputArray%20kernel,%20Point%20anchor,%20double%20delta,%20int%20borderType%29
src
must be larger (in both dimensions) than filter.
filter
is assumed to be floor(size(filter)/2)+1.
dst's data types: CV_64F

simplesect.para: the mean value of a double vector

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< double > &segment, double minPeakDistance, double threshold, vector< double > &max_peak_strengths, vector< int > &max_peak_locs)
memberdef.name: findpeaks

detaileddescription.para:
findpeaks in segment, with minPeakDistance and threshold, complexity O(n^2) with n = number of peaks
segment
a vector of signals
minPeakDistance
minimum distance between two peaks
threshold
the minimum value that a peak point should be larger than its two neighbors point
max_peak_strengths
max_peak_locs

remove all identical item in the arr, two items are equal if the second value (type int) of them are equal. all identical item will be removed just left the first appearing value. the order will be reserve.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< double > signal, vector< double > kernel, bool subtractMean)
memberdef.name: corr_linear

simplesect.para: 1D convolution operation of 2 vectors signal and kernel

parameterdescription.para: if is true, then before all calculations, each elements of the signal vector will be subtracted by mean(signal), and each elements of the kernel vector will be subtracted by mean(kernel).

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< double > &arr, int nbins, vector< int > &counts, vector< double > &centers)
memberdef.name: hist

simplesect.para: counts: number of elements in each bin,

centers: the center value of each bin get the histogram of arr's value, the range from min value to max value of the arr will be divided into nbins bins, each bin will have a centres point and a count value denoting number of value in the array belong to that bin's range

detaileddescription.para:
get the invert percentile of arr with value x.
the percent of number of values in arr that smaller or equal x.
get the percentile of arr with a percent value.
filter function for frames2signal function, apply low pass filter on vector arr. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Low-pass_filter

simplesect.para: a new Mat which each element[i, j] = atan2(a[i, j], b[i, j]) Data type: CV_64F
the n-th power of src (element-wise) Data type: CV_64F
a new Mat which each element[i, j] = a[i, j] * x Data type: CV_64F
